messages.message:
Hi everyone, I was just wondering if there was an easier way to convert a `docx`  to a `pdf`  file, Tried searching over the web, I could not find a way to convert docx to pdf directly.
Although there are utilities to convert  `docx`  to `html`   https://pypi.org/project/docx2html/
 and then `html`   to `pdf`    https://pypi.org/project/pdfkit/
Is there any better way this could be achieved?
hi, what’s the use case? why are you trying to convert to pdf?
It is the document generation step, It currently converts to docx based on a template file! I could add an optional flag to convert to pdf.
Have you looked at pandoc? There’s probably a python wrapper floating around

@Paul H looks great! I was looking at instructions for installing to various platform, I am quite unsure about the deployed environment and based on the build config in travis, it says `xenial`  linux ! I am looking at https://pandoc.org/installing.html
@Heymian, can you suggest as to why or why not the package might not be suitably integrable ?

We’re on Ubuntu, specifically 18.04. I think the problem with using pandoc in our code base is licensing. I just took a look and it’s GPL v2. We can’t easily use it because it would potentially force to us to open source the application that’s using it (aka our code base). So we generally try to avoid GPL packages if possible.
